intro: Scorzonera hemilasia, commonly known as the Armenian scorzonera, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer, attracting various pollinators. Scorzonera hemilasia is valued for its edible roots and has been traditionally used in local cuisines and herbal medicine.
